answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some sample policies that could help answer your question. Below I included advertising policies from different media sources which address how non-profits fit into that system.
This is the web policy of East Lansing, MI which includes their online advertising policies at the bottom of the page.
http://www.cityofeastlansing.com/Home/WebPolicy.aspx
You can view the banner advertising policy of Aspen, CO as it relates to non-profits.
http://www.aspenpitkin.com/Portals/0/docs/Banners%20Over%20Main%20Street%20Policy%20and%20Procedures.pdf
I have also included the link to the advertising policy of the public television channel in Milan, MI.
http://milanmich.org/Cable/cable_regs_form%20.pdf
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org


Hello,

I found some sample policies that could help answer your question. Below I included advertising policies from different media sources which address how non-profits fit into that system.

This is the web policy of East Lansing, MI which includes their online advertising policies at the bottom of the page.

author: Monica Gutierrez
text: Does anyone have a sample policy or white paper that addresses a municipalitites role in advertsing/marketing events for non-proft organizations?
title: Non-profit event advertising
